subject: Optimize Gnocchi fetcher processing time
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2023-04-03 13:27:55.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkitty/fetcher/gnocchi.py', 'cloudkitty/tests/fetchers/test_gnocchi.py', 'releasenotes/notes/optimize_gnochi-fetcher-runtime-3604026816.yaml'], 'message': 'Optimize Gnocchi fetcher processing time

Following the footsteps of [1], depending on the environment where
CloudKitty is applied, when using Gnocchi fetcher, if the environment is
considerably big, CloudKitty tends to take too much time loading the
scope IDs from the Gnocchi API. To reduce that process time, we adopted
a different approach to discover the scope IDs registered in Gnocchi.

This patch proposes a change in that process, building on top of [1] to
load the chunk of Gnocchi resources and execute the retrieval of the
scope ID and selecting only the unique ones right away. Then, in the
worst case scenario, we would only have 1000 resources being loaded to
memory. Furthermore, we use the ``search`` API method from Gnocchi to
filter resources that are from scopes that are not in the set already
loaded. Therefore, we do not need to go over all of the resources in
Gnocchi. We will only list all of the resources that do not have the
scope IDs already loaded.

This reduced the processing time to load scope IDs from about 5 minutes
to 40 seconds in an environment with 500 scopes and ~50,000 resources.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cloudkitty/+/864269

Change-Id: I9fa8934c5c857bd0069bb8038423e0126739a310
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize Gnocchi fetcher processing time

Following the footsteps of [1], depending on the environment where
CloudKitty is applied, when using Gnocchi fetcher, if the environment is
considerably big, CloudKitty tends to take too much time loading the
scope IDs from the Gnocchi API. To reduce that process time, we adopted
a different approach to discover the scope IDs registered in Gnocchi.

This patch proposes a change in that process, building on top of [1] to
load the chunk of Gnocchi resources and execute the retrieval of the
scope ID and selecting only the unique ones right away. Then, in the
worst case scenario, we would only have 1000 resources being loaded to
memory. Furthermore, we use the ``search`` API method from Gnocchi to
filter resources that are from scopes that are not in the set already
loaded. Therefore, we do not need to go over all of the resources in
Gnocchi. We will only list all of the resources that do not have the
scope IDs already loaded.

This reduced the processing time to load scope IDs from about 5 minutes
to 40 seconds in an environment with 500 scopes and ~50,000 resources.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cloudkitty/+/864269

Change-Id: I9fa8934c5c857bd0069bb8038423e0126739a310

commit_message:
Add jsonrpc port to database

Adds the RPC port to the database for the running
RPC service. Later on this is to enable us to
be able to some day enable JSONRPC to connect to the
specific port as opposed to the default.

Change-Id: I3954fce26d175c87acd5131c44de23be136fd624

subject: Ensure redirect-type=bridged not used for geneve networks
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8655, 'name': 'Jakub Libosvar', 'email': 'libosvar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jlibosva'}, {'_account_id': 9845, 'name': 'Arista CI', 'email': 'arista-openstack-test@aristanetworks.com', 'username': 'arista-test', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11975, 'name': 'Slawek Kaplonski', 'email': 'skaplons@redhat.com', 'username': 'slaweq'}, {'_account_id': 16688, 'name': 'Rodolfo Alonso', 'email': 'ralonsoh@redhat.com', 'username': 'rodolfo-alonso-hernandez'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23567, 'name': 'Luis Tomas Bolivar', 'email': 'ltomasbo@redhat.com', 'username': 'ltomasbo'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 21, 'created': '2023-03-31 21:10:42.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/test_maintenance.py', 'neutron/common/ovn/constants.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/maintenance.py', 'releasenotes/notes/redirect-type-f29e89ca97357fe9.yaml'], 'message': 'Ensure redirect-type=bridged not used for geneve networks

As part of [1] the redirect-type=bridged flag was enabled by default.
However this have the side effect of also decentralizing N/S traffic
for geneve tenant networks, breaking the VM connectivity on them when
it must be centralized, i.e., when no FIPs are associated to the VMs.

This patch differentiates and only enable that flag when the networks
conected through that router gateway port are of VLAN/FLAT type.

In addition, to avoid MTU issues for the VLAN networks if there are
also geneve networks connected to the same router, we re-take the
approach on [2] to ensure the traffic is centralized but not tunneled

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/875644
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/875676

Closes-Bug: #2012712

Change-Id: I25e5ee2cf8daee52221a640faa7ac09679742707
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure redirect-type=bridged not used for geneve networks

As part of [1] the redirect-type=bridged flag was enabled by default.
However this have the side effect of also decentralizing N/S traffic
for geneve tenant networks, breaking the VM connectivity on them when
it must be centralized, i.e., when no FIPs are associated to the VMs.

This patch differentiates and only enable that flag when the networks
conected through that router gateway port are of VLAN/FLAT type.

In addition, to avoid MTU issues for the VLAN networks if there are
also geneve networks connected to the same router, we re-take the
approach on [2] to ensure the traffic is centralized but not tunneled

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/875644
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/875676

Closes-Bug: #2012712

Change-Id: I25e5ee2cf8daee52221a640faa7ac09679742707

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-31 19:10:38.000000000', 'files': ['kolla/image/tasks.py', 'kolla/tests/test_build.py'], 'message': "Fix test malicious tarball fail

Since I650fcbc8f773fad8116338f6fb0cf7b4f4f17b33 builds from git fails
on plugins with an exception: 'tarfile.ReadError: not a gzip file'
because the test checks only gzip compressed archives but plugins
created as plain tar files. This change fixes the issue using

commit_message:
Fix test malicious tarball fail

Since I650fcbc8f773fad8116338f6fb0cf7b4f4f17b33 builds from git fails
on plugins with an exception: 'tarfile.ReadError: not a gzip file'
because the test checks only gzip compressed archives but plugins
created as plain tar files. This change fixes the issue using
transparent compression support and also adds some debug info.

Closes-Bug: #1990432
Change-Id: If0f9b4dd058a257d0653332d1b663e150c717304
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Michal Nasiadka <mnasiadka@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 143765fb67221cc51f1dc56a41ac2b67dddc453f)

The method ``get_l3_agents_by_router_ids`` is retrieving the
``RouterL3AgentBinding`` registers along with the ``Agent`` information.
This left outer join should be explictly defined using the database
model.

Expected query:
  SELECT routerl3agentbindings.router_id AS ...
  FROM routerl3agentbindings
  LEFT OUTER JOIN agents ON agents.id = routerl3agentbindings.l3_agent_id
  WHERE routerl3agentbindings.router_id IN (XXX)

commit_message:
[sqlalchemy-20] Do not use strings for aatribute names in loader options

The method ``get_l3_agents_by_router_ids`` is retrieving the
``RouterL3AgentBinding`` registers along with the ``Agent`` information.
This left outer join should be explictly defined using the database
model.

Expected query:
  SELECT routerl3agentbindings.router_id AS ...
  FROM routerl3agentbindings
  LEFT OUTER JOIN agents ON agents.id = routerl3agentbindings.l3_agent_id
  WHERE routerl3agentbindings.router_id IN (XXX)

Closes-Bug: #2012662
Change-Id: Ife9ba5d774934d2cd1a86b3281b78e854d88de3c

function that wraps _post_live_migration and just ensures

when we are in _post_live_migration the guest has already
started running on the destination host and we cannot revert.

commit_message:
[compute] always set instance.host in post_livemigration

This change add a new _post_live_migration_update_host
function that wraps _post_live_migration and just ensures
that if we exit due to an exception instance.host is set
to the destination host.

when we are in _post_live_migration the guest has already
started running on the destination host and we cannot revert.
Sometimes admins or users will hard reboot the instance expecting
that to fix everything when the vm enters the error state after
the failed migrations. Previously this would end up recreating the
instance on the source node leading to possible data corruption if
the instance used shared storage.

NOTE(auniyal): Differences from ussuri to train
  * nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py
  * Added instance.migration_context value to None, as fake_instance do not have this property in train

Change-Id: Ibc4bc7edf1c8d1e841c72c9188a0a62836e9f153
Partial-Bug: #1628606

commit_message:
Retire the stable/focal git branch.

This (stable) branch was cut originally to support the
mysql-innodb-cluster charm with the "20.04" base, although due to a
series of events to simplify the management it was decided to use the
stable/jammy git branch to source the `8.0` charmhub track and provide a
charm capable of running on "20.04" and "22.04".

Change-Id: I3e0e6a3f0e99f59d98778298d56e72bbfa837b80

subject: Add LimitRequestBody configuration for Horizon
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2023-03-29 11:52:05.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/horizon/templates/horizon.conf.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/add-horizon-limitrequestbody-4f79433fa2cf1f6d.yaml'], 'message': 'Add LimitRequestBody configuration for Horizon

Since CVE-2022-29404 is fixed [1,2] the default value for the
LimitRequestBody directive in the Apache HTTP Server has been changed
from 0 (unlimited) to 1 GiB. This limits the size of images (for
example) uploaded in Horizon. This change add the ability to

1. https://access.redhat.com/articles/6975397
2. https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2022-29404

Closes-Bug: #2012588

Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add LimitRequestBody configuration for Horizon

Since CVE-2022-29404 is fixed [1,2] the default value for the
LimitRequestBody directive in the Apache HTTP Server has been changed
from 0 (unlimited) to 1 GiB. This limits the size of images (for
example) uploaded in Horizon. This change add the ability to
configure the limit.

1. https://access.redhat.com/articles/6975397
2. https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2022-29404

Closes-Bug: #2012588

commit_message:
Fix floating ip selection

The floating ip selection didn't count with possibility of
stopped workloads on the environment. We now list running hosts
and join them against available virtual ips.

Co-authored-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7d46100eccf43159f47e620d14fae3b66701a4d9

commit_message:
Fix floating ip selection

The floating ip selection didn't count with possibility of
stopped workloads on the environment. We now list running hosts
and join them against available virtual ips.

Co-authored-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7d46100eccf43159f47e620d14fae3b66701a4d9
(cherry picked from commit cd5a4287461b91d57b7058ad63928436b0f1efcb)

commit_message:
Do not add bracket for IPv6 addresses in no_proxy

IPv6 addresses in no_proxy environment should NOT be surrounded by [],
otherwise the addresses are just ignored.

Resolves: rhbz#2180677
Change-Id: I1b7c9a671078d93ff272d3feef053c1208ab9088

commit_message:
Fix unit tests for plugin package management

- The whole test cases were ignored

- python3-aodh-tests resource is never declared

- available packages are different according to operating system

- neutron_available toggles only the neutron-tempest-plugin package and
  does not affect the packages for optional pluginske l2gw.

Change-Id: I83bc0d6bbd62d19b17d1bbe2ff5eb434fdd26828

commit_message:
Create octavia multi-vCPU flavor

Candidate for backport to Wallaby.

Creates a new Nova flavor, an Octavia flavorprofile and a Octavia flavor
that can be used for creating loadbalancers.
This can boost the network throughput when using Amphorae with
multiple vCPUs.

commit_message:
Fix base class for ovn charms

The charm classes were reworked to support k8s and machine charms
as part of this OSBaseOperatorCharm no longer contains k8s
components. However the k8s ovn charms have their own charm class
OSBaseOVNOperatorCharm which is for ovn k8s services so should
be based in OSBaseOperatorCharmk8s

Change-Id: Ieb43eb22c8c91c7b6776b3d309e244578d4d7c13

commit_message:
Add workaround for announce mail script

Somewhere between today and March 23rd, 2023, pbr started to print a
log.info line when we try to fetch a package's name from setup.py, e.g:

$ python3 setup.py --name 2>/dev/null
[pbr] Generating ChangeLog
openstack_releases

A workaround is now added to our announce script to avoid garbled
announce mails [1].

[1] https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-announce/2023-March/014246.html

Change-Id: I6233bb8d12a12efd3cb02abd29d8d43d7fd91da2

subject: Check whether a directory specific for this OS flavour (release+version) exists, and use that to pull the list of packages from, if available. Debian release version numbers consist of two numbers, <major>.<point>. For the current version of Stretch, at the point of this writing, the number is "9.5". The algorithm first tries to find a directory called "debs-Debian-9.5", then "debs-Debian-9", and then "debs". If one of these directories exists, it needs to contain the packages lists. For Ubuntu, the package lists are all in "debs".
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-19 19:49:06.000000000', 'files': ['lib/databases/mysql', 'files/debs-Debian-9/general', 'files/debs-Debian-9/openvswitch', 'files/debs-Debian-9/neutron-agent', 'files/debs-Debian-9/neutron-common', 'files/debs-Debian-9/ldap', 'files/debs-Debian-9/keystone', 'files/debs-Debian-9/q-l3', 'files/debs-Debian-9/dstat', 'files/debs-Debian-9/tls-proxy', 'files/debs-Debian-9/baremetal', 'files/debs-Debian-9/n-cpu', 'files/debs-Debian-9/neutron-l3', 'functions-common', 'files/debs-Debian-9/cinder', 'files/debs-Debian-9/nova', 'files/debs-Debian-9/horizon', 'files/debs-Debian-9/ceph', 'files/debs-Debian-9/q-agt', 'files/debs-Debian-9/swift'], 'message': 'Check whether a directory specific for this OS flavour
(release+version) exists, and use that to pull the list
of packages from, if available. Debian release version
numbers consist of two numbers, <major>.<point>. For
the current version of Stretch, at the point of this
writing, the number is "9.5". The algorithm first tries
to find a directory called "debs-Debian-9.5", then
"debs-Debian-9", and then "debs". If one of these
directories exists, it needs to contain the packages
lists. For Ubuntu, the package lists are all in
"debs".

As a side effect, package lists may now be completely
independent on a per-release basis, so this patch also
installs "build-essential" instead of just gcc and g++.

Also, the package fixes the authentication problem in
Debian, as the code always assumes a TCP connection to
the database, but the standard Debian setup is to only
allow a Unix domain socket for management purposes.

Co-Authored-By: j.harbott@x-ion.de
Change-Id: I854d6d0e870a8c18a32353ab3fb20e440fb94969
'}]
commit_message:
Check whether a directory specific for this OS flavour
(release+version) exists, and use that to pull the list
of packages from, if available. Debian release version
numbers consist of two numbers, <major>.<point>. For
the current version of Stretch, at the point of this
writing, the number is "9.5". The algorithm first tries
to find a directory called "debs-Debian-9.5", then
"debs-Debian-9", and then "debs". If one of these
directories exists, it needs to contain the packages
lists. For Ubuntu, the package lists are all in
"debs".

As a side effect, package lists may now be completely
independent on a per-release basis, so this patch also
installs "build-essential" instead of just gcc and g++.

Also, the package fixes the authentication problem in
Debian, as the code always assumes a TCP connection to
the database, but the standard Debian setup is to only
allow a Unix domain socket for management purposes.

Co-Authored-By: j.harbott@x-ion.de
Change-Id: I854d6d0e870a8c18a32353ab3fb20e440fb94969

subject: Allow single or multiple spaces in sedding neutron's policy file
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-02 09:46:27.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron-legacy'], 'message': 'Allow single or multiple spaces in sedding neutron's policy file

In neutron's policy file, the "'context_is_admin':  'role:admin'" rule
has tow spaces after the ':' and there usually is a single space.

There is no problem if the we don't modify the policy file. However,
new oslo policy aims to maintain policy in code, and there is only a
space after the ':' in the policy file genarated by oslo policy, which
will cause tests failure of most neutron gate. Therefore, we should
make sure the sed rule can replace the policy including only one space.

Change-Id: I279b09d0178edb54bb9b988b179754e75ed87361
'}]
commit_message:
Allow single or multiple spaces in sedding neutron's policy file

In neutron's policy file, the "'context_is_admin':  'role:admin'" rule
has tow spaces after the ':' and there usually is a single space.

There is no problem if the we don't modify the policy file. However,
new oslo policy aims to maintain policy in code, and there is only a
space after the ':' in the policy file genarated by oslo policy, which
will cause tests failure of most neutron gate. Therefore, we should
make sure the sed rule can replace the policy including only one space.

Change-Id: I279b09d0178edb54bb9b988b179754e75ed87361

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2023-02-14 19:46:45.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Cap virtualenv (<20.18.0) to unblock gate

With latest virtualenv (and setuptools bundled in it) py3*-check-uc
jobs started to fail as pkg_resources' __getattr__ breaks on multiple
packages' metadata.

Release is very close and library release upper constraints bumping
patches are piling up. This patch is a workaround only to unblock the
gate and need to be reverted as soon as the py3*-check-uc jobs works
well with the latest virtualenv and setuptools releases.

Change-Id: I36ae32a401844bf5a5df0d20d3f88f24b2a0cf8e
"}]
commit_message:
Cap virtualenv (<20.18.0) to unblock gate

With latest virtualenv (and setuptools bundled in it) py3*-check-uc
jobs started to fail as pkg_resources' __getattr__ breaks on multiple
packages' metadata.

Release is very close and library release upper constraints bumping
patches are piling up. This patch is a workaround only to unblock the
gate and need to be reverted as soon as the py3*-check-uc jobs works
well with the latest virtualenv and setuptools releases.

Change-Id: I36ae32a401844bf5a5df0d20d3f88f24b2a0cf8e

commit_message:
Update devstack to support Fedora 32

Currently supported releases for Fedora are
Fedora 31 and Fedora 32. More information in
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/End_of_life.

This change updates stack.sh so we can Devstack
on Fedora 32 without setting the FORCE=yes env
variable.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-09-26 00:09:06.000000000', 'files': ['lib/keystone'], 'message': 'Require that service tokens have the service role

The intent of the X-Service-Token inter-service communications is that
only a service account such as nova, cinder etc should be submitting the
service token. To do this we have to validate that the token that is
transmitted should have the service role.

Change-Id: Ia35c262f59a61fd6405533fe17cda154c9c4073d
'}]
commit_message:
Require that service tokens have the service role

The intent of the X-Service-Token inter-service communications is that
only a service account such as nova, cinder etc should be submitting the
service token. To do this we have to validate that the token that is
transmitted should have the service role.

Change-Id: Ia35c262f59a61fd6405533fe17cda154c9c4073d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-01 21:45:05.000000000', 'files': ['lib/cinder', 'lib/neutron', 'lib/nova', 'lib/keystone', 'lib/glance', 'lib/databases/mysql-cluster'], 'message': "Enable devstack to optionally install mysql-cluster

This change will allow a devstack deployment to optionally install
mysql-cluster.

To enable mysql-cluster, you will need to update devstack's local.conf
file. The changes needed in local.conf are:

  Change: DATABASE_TYPE=mysql-cluster
  Add: mysql-cluster to ENABLED_SERVICES
  Remove: mysql from ENABLED_SERVICES

There are two environmental variables that can be used to point to the
mysql-cluster repository and the version to be used. If they are not
specified, the default values are used.

  MYSQL_CLUSTER_REPO_URL (default value is http://repo.mysql.com/apt/ubuntu)

  MYSQL_CLUSTER_VERSION (default value is mysql-cluster-7.5)

Currently, mysql-cluster devstack deployment has only been tested on Ubuntu
16.04 on a single node.

Depends-On: I49ca3906df78c3cfbad4012bcdf777f701c69382
Depends-On: I597d6ab50fe117e725f1d8de9b359ac9fbb79eb3

Depends-On: Id717406bdb34bec20c57ae9ae0e50607738fb91d
Change-Id: I95525e63c073eb4fc8f3b1092d371af5a6e008cb
Implements: blueprint mysql-cluster-support
"}]
commit_message:
Enable devstack to optionally install mysql-cluster

This change will allow a devstack deployment to optionally install
mysql-cluster.

To enable mysql-cluster, you will need to update devstack's local.conf
file. The changes needed in local.conf are:

  Change: DATABASE_TYPE=mysql-cluster
  Add: mysql-cluster to ENABLED_SERVICES
  Remove: mysql from ENABLED_SERVICES

There are two environmental variables that can be used to point to the
mysql-cluster repository and the version to be used. If they are not
specified, the default values are used.

  MYSQL_CLUSTER_REPO_URL (default value is http://repo.mysql.com/apt/ubuntu)

  MYSQL_CLUSTER_VERSION (default value is mysql-cluster-7.5)

Currently, mysql-cluster devstack deployment has only been tested on Ubuntu
16.04 on a single node.

Depends-On: I49ca3906df78c3cfbad4012bcdf777f701c69382
Depends-On: I597d6ab50fe117e725f1d8de9b359ac9fbb79eb3
Depends-On: Idf6e1f65ddb07e85ce864477aead976fd9a6af27
Depends-On: I06e08a7d0788606143cb9d5a500ca6bb36c907a0
Depends-On: Id717406bdb34bec20c57ae9ae0e50607738fb91d
Change-Id: I95525e63c073eb4fc8f3b1092d371af5a6e008cb
Implements: blueprint mysql-cluster-support

commit_message:
Octavia Jobboard integration

Add parameters for configuring Octavia Jobboard for the amphorav2
provider.

Jobboard for Octavia is enabled by the OctaviaEnableJobbard (default
false), Octavia is configured by puppet and THT creates an additional
database to store persistent objects managed by Octavia (dbname is
octavia_persistence).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/874836

Change-Id: Ia16b840ce63319375eddf860a4024c2ad47fab96
(cherry picked from commit 3f55cbfbcf34822ca35f12240d7ebac6270ed6cf)

subject: Fix test malicious tarball fail
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2023-03-31 12:35:42.000000000', 'files': ['kolla/image/tasks.py', 'kolla/tests/test_build.py'], 'message': "Fix test malicious tarball fail

Since I650fcbc8f773fad8116338f6fb0cf7b4f4f17b33 builds from git fails
on plugins with an exception: 'tarfile.ReadError: not a gzip file'
because the test checks only gzip compressed archives but plugins
created as plain tar files. This change fixes the issue using
transparent compression support and also adds some debug info.

Closes-Bug: #1990432
Change-Id: If0f9b4dd058a257d0653332d1b663e150c717304
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Michal Nasiadka <mnasiadka@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix test malicious tarball fail

Since I650fcbc8f773fad8116338f6fb0cf7b4f4f17b33 builds from git fails
on plugins with an exception: 'tarfile.ReadError: not a gzip file'
because the test checks only gzip compressed archives but plugins
created as plain tar files. This change fixes the issue using
transparent compression support and also adds some debug info.

Closes-Bug: #1990432
Change-Id: If0f9b4dd058a257d0653332d1b663e150c717304
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Michal Nasiadka <mnasiadka@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update opensuse version

Nova has newer qemu requirements which needs opensuse 15.2 to meet. The
infra opensuse 15 images are 15.2 now to accomodate that. Update
opensuse's supported version to match.

Change-Id: I6f3c5234920b185b2b0cd9c358371402f7a7b922

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2021-07-02 20:39:42.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/services/l3'], 'message': 'Revert "Add route to IPv6 private subnets in ML2/OVN"

This reverts commit 949f5ada608961fd05435e01bd9d06757b6c62c5.

Reason for revert: This is breaking basic devstack when using neutron's ovn sample file:

    https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/devstack/ovn-local.conf.sample

    central: + lib/neutron_plugins/services/l3:_neutron_configure_router_v6:422 :   sudo ip -6 addr replace 2001:db8::2/64 dev br-ex
    central: RTNETLINK answers: Permission denied
    central: + lib/neutron_plugins/services/l3:_neutron_configure_router_v6:1 :   exit_trap
    central: + ./stack.sh:exit_trap:503                 :   local r=2

Change-Id: I76e345de3e86bb917a2e77f4a3e3dff029f1eec1
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add route to IPv6 private subnets in ML2/OVN"

This reverts commit 949f5ada608961fd05435e01bd9d06757b6c62c5.

Reason for revert: This is breaking basic devstack when using neutron's ovn sample file:

    https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/devstack/ovn-local.conf.sample

    central: + lib/neutron_plugins/services/l3:_neutron_configure_router_v6:422 :   sudo ip -6 addr replace 2001:db8::2/64 dev br-ex
    central: RTNETLINK answers: Permission denied
    central: + lib/neutron_plugins/services/l3:_neutron_configure_router_v6:1 :   exit_trap
    central: + ./stack.sh:exit_trap:503                 :   local r=2

Change-Id: I76e345de3e86bb917a2e77f4a3e3dff029f1eec1

subject: [WIP] add aarch64 devstack job
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2022-02-10 03:52:41.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': '[WIP] add aarch64 devstack job

This patch tries to create an AArch64 based job to test
openstack on arm based on my recnet use of devstack on an m1 macbook air.

while i have not run tempest locally yet i have been able to boot an
all in one devstack in 6GB vm using ubuntu 20.04 and manually boot vms
using the upstream cirros image.

this patch tries to replicate that in the upstream ci and run tempest
full using the ubuntu-focal-arm64 nodepool lable.

placement, cinder and glance.

other service can be added in the future once the core set are stable.

Change-Id: I7e61c8e569a8d05942957835c97c05c77c5979f4
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] add aarch64 devstack job

This patch tries to create an AArch64 based job to test
openstack on arm based on my recnet use of devstack on an m1 macbook air.

while i have not run tempest locally yet i have been able to boot an
all in one devstack in 6GB vm using ubuntu 20.04 and manually boot vms
using the upstream cirros image.

this patch tries to replicate that in the upstream ci and run tempest
full using the ubuntu-focal-arm64 nodepool lable.

initally all service i have not tested locally have been disbaled creating
a more or less minimal install comprising nova, neutron, keystone
placement, cinder and glance.

other service can be added in the future once the core set are stable.

Change-Id: I7e61c8e569a8d05942957835c97c05c77c5979f4

subject: remove egg-link files on unstack
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2022-02-10 03:52:41.000000000', 'files': ['unstack.sh'], 'message': 'remove egg-link files on unstack

on some distros (ubuntu 20.04 aarch64) pip will refuse to uninstall
packages that are not located under /usr.
This breaks unstacking and restacking as the second install can
refuse to uninstall the exising copy.

to adress this in addtion to removing the pyc files unstack.sh will
now remove the egg-link files so that pip no longer considers the
repos installed in $DEST (/opt/stack) as installed.

Change-Id: I6795cdf23985a2de645f512cecc57a40a4b253f1
'}]
commit_message:
remove egg-link files on unstack

on some distros (ubuntu 20.04 aarch64) pip will refuse to uninstall
packages that are not located under /usr.
This breaks unstacking and restacking as the second install can
refuse to uninstall the exising copy.

to adress this in addtion to removing the pyc files unstack.sh will
now remove the egg-link files so that pip no longer considers the
repos installed in $DEST (/opt/stack) as installed.

Change-Id: I6795cdf23985a2de645f512cecc57a40a4b253f1

subject: set default LIBVIRT_CPU_MODEL based on ARCH
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2022-02-10 03:52:41.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova', 'lib/nova_plugins/hypervisor-libvirt', 'stackrc'], 'message': 'set default LIBVIRT_CPU_MODEL based on ARCH

This change mainntains the current default for x86_64
updates LIBVIRT_CPU_MODEL to max on aarch64 and

To ensure correct defaults, fallback to qemu is moved to

commit_message:
set default LIBVIRT_CPU_MODEL based on ARCH

This change mainntains the current default for x86_64
updates LIBVIRT_CPU_MODEL to max on aarch64 and
qemu64 for lack of a better default on anything else.

To ensure correct defaults, fallback to qemu is moved to
stackrc and aarch64 host are only set to host-passthrough
if kvm is available.

Change-Id: Ie3175069db75c4b3a7a3cfd9df136017c22618df

subject: Use master upper-constraints when install_temepst's creating venv
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2020-01-19 01:29:28.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': "Use master upper-constraints when install_temepst's creating venv

Below patch has changed the configure_tempest() to use
master branch's upper-constraints to avoid conflict in requirement
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/473525/

install_tempest() still use the branch based upper_contraint. Which
has no issue as the same venv will be build/install with master's
upper_constraint in configure_tempest() method.

We can use master's upper_constraint in install_tempest() also
so that from starting of venv creation we use master constraint
and avoid duplicate uninstall/install the dependency.

Change-Id: I5e7b58eb0c07c509e340afbfcd2b402c651c3731
Related-bug: #1706009
"}]
commit_message:
Use master upper-constraints when install_temepst's creating venv

Below patch has changed the configure_tempest() to use
master branch's upper-constraints to avoid conflict in requirement
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/473525/

install_tempest() still use the branch based upper_contraint. Which
has no issue as the same venv will be build/install with master's
upper_constraint in configure_tempest() method.

We can use master's upper_constraint in install_tempest() also
so that from starting of venv creation we use master constraint
and avoid duplicate uninstall/install the dependency.

Change-Id: I5e7b58eb0c07c509e340afbfcd2b402c651c3731
Related-bug: #1706009

subject: Install master delorean-deps
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2021-02-17 16:45:38.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'message': 'Install master delorean-deps

Package rdo-release.rpm is intended to configure CloudSIG repositories,
and those are only for released versions. It defaults to the latest
released OpenStack series. As so, required greatest and latest
dependencies in master OpenStack may not be met. For CentOS-based master
devstack deployments the latest and greatest dependency packages need to
be available, and that is provided by master delorean-deps [1].

[1] https://dlrn.readthedocs.io/en/latest/repositories.html#dlrn-repository-delorean-deps

Change-Id: Id9f96f6dd55e964c32a7da8633c5acea2e1133b8
'}]
commit_message:
Install master delorean-deps

Package rdo-release.rpm is intended to configure CloudSIG repositories,
and those are only for released versions. It defaults to the latest
released OpenStack series. As so, required greatest and latest
dependencies in master OpenStack may not be met. For CentOS-based master
devstack deployments the latest and greatest dependency packages need to
be available, and that is provided by master delorean-deps [1].

[1] https://dlrn.readthedocs.io/en/latest/repositories.html#dlrn-repository-delorean-deps

Change-Id: Id9f96f6dd55e964c32a7da8633c5acea2e1133b8

We use a light shell daemon to start "workload_launch.sh sanityfast"
in a loop.

The daemon, collect the log of each individual run in a "ccp-<PID>"
directory and the result in check-control-plane-<PID>.log.  The pid
can be found in check-control-plane.pid.

In tripleo-upgrade we add the usual check integration at the relevant

"--update-controlplane-check" is added to the infrared interface.

Change-Id: Ieff860667cf67a1c1f67221b05575e952a0636fa
'}]
commit_message:
Add control plane testing during update.

We use a light shell daemon to start "workload_launch.sh sanityfast"
in a loop.

The daemon, collect the log of each individual run in a "ccp-<PID>"
directory and the result in check-control-plane-<PID>.log.  The pid
can be found in check-control-plane.pid.

In tripleo-upgrade we add the usual check integration at the relevant
part of the update. The new boolean option
"--update-controlplane-check" is added to the infrared interface.

By default this test is not activated. control_plane_check variable
control that behavior outside of infrared.

Change-Id: Ieff860667cf67a1c1f67221b05575e952a0636fa

commit_message:
Fix floating ip selection

The floating ip selection didn't count with possibility of
stopped workloads on the environment. We now list running hosts
and join them against available virtual ips.

Co-authored-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7d46100eccf43159f47e620d14fae3b66701a4d9
(cherry picked from commit cd5a4287461b91d57b7058ad63928436b0f1efcb)

commit_message:
Use SDK instead of neutronclient

The python-neutronclient has been deprecated for the CLI since Ocata and
the python bindings "neutronclient" has been deprecated for removal as
of the 2023.1 (Antelope) release[1] in favor of using openstacksdk.
This patch migrates Designate from using the neutronclient to using the
openstacksdk for communicating with neutron.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/python-neutronclient/2023.1.html

Co-Authored-By: Michael Johnson <johnsomor@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I0198f38afe3d5c32ea06d9e674ab0ff849f360e6
Related-Bug: #1999774

subject: Pin openvswitch package on RHEL to 2.17
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-31 12:32:45.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-9.yml'], 'message': "Pin openvswitch package on RHEL to 2.17

OVS 3.1 was released by CentOS NFV SIG which is built against newer
rdma-core libraries leading to uninstallable openvswitch3.1 on
Rocky Linux due to missing libmlx5.so.1(MLX5_1.24).

While CentOS doesn't need this specific rollback, it will be easier to
fix gates this way.

Closes-Bug: #2013189
Change-Id: I388c115d368c0c0638d1dd4f9f11f4448a13a6b1
(cherry picked from commit 181036c13bd2e9b09dabba6faea827c99a8adf6c)
"}]
commit_message:
Pin openvswitch package on RHEL to 2.17

OVS 3.1 was released by CentOS NFV SIG which is built against newer
rdma-core libraries leading to uninstallable openvswitch3.1 on
Rocky Linux due to missing libmlx5.so.1(MLX5_1.24).

While CentOS doesn't need this specific rollback, it will be easier to
fix gates this way.

Closes-Bug: #2013189
Change-Id: I388c115d368c0c0638d1dd4f9f11f4448a13a6b1
(cherry picked from commit 181036c13bd2e9b09dabba6faea827c99a8adf6c)

commit_message:
Add virtualization (virt) repo to StarlingX

This new repository will be the new place to store code related to
StarlingX virtualization packages and tools.
It will be the result of splitting the virt directory from
starlingx/integ in order to separate the virtualization stack from it.

Signed-off-by: Thales Elero Cervi <thaleselero.cervi@windriver.com>

revisions:

commit_message:
Fix floating ip selection

The floating ip selection didn't count with possibility of
stopped workloads on the environment. We now list running hosts
and join them against available virtual ips.

Co-authored-by: Lukas Bezdicka <social@v3.sk>
Change-Id: I8df76b707abf2e6030bb01eb29bcb31b13b8fbb2

subject: Rework zuul config
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-03-31 08:22:45.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/acceptance-jobs.yaml', 'zuul.d/project.yaml', 'zuul.d/functional-jobs.yaml', 'zuul.d/metal-jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'Rework zuul config

Current zuul.yaml file is simply way to big to be able to navigate in it
easily. We are going to add some more acceptance jobs which bring quite
big secrets and this will make it even less maintainable.

Split .zuul.yaml into few zuul.d/* entries using Zuul capability to have
few "project" entries and get them merged.

Change-Id: I9c6a85d4d6f1cdfcb5a339bca4293d54d5cf8746
'}]
commit_message:
Rework zuul config

Current zuul.yaml file is simply way to big to be able to navigate in it
easily. We are going to add some more acceptance jobs which bring quite
big secrets and this will make it even less maintainable.

Split .zuul.yaml into few zuul.d/* entries using Zuul capability to have
few "project" entries and get them merged.

Change-Id: I9c6a85d4d6f1cdfcb5a339bca4293d54d5cf8746

commit_message:
Fix floating ip selection

The floating ip selection didn't count with possibility of
stopped workloads on the environment. We now list running hosts
and join them against available virtual ips.

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-10 09:27:13.000000000', 'files': ['specs/approved/support-iscdhcpdriver-for-standalone-deployment.rst', 'specs/not-implemented/support-iscdhcpdriver-for-standalone-deployment.rst'], 'message': 'Support ISCDHCPDriver for Standalone Deployment

Ironic currently supports several dhcp provider:neutron,none.
We have only one option for deploying ironic node with standalone.
We need to configure dhcp manually in this case.

commit_message:
Support ISCDHCPDriver for Standalone Deployment

Ironic currently supports several dhcp provider:neutron,none.
We have only one option for deploying ironic node with standalone.
We need to configure dhcp manually in this case.
New DHCP Provider will be added for standalone deployment.
ISCDHCPDriver configures isc-dhcp-server which is
default dhcp server automatically
therefore we does not have to handle manually.

Change-Id: I6b548c913bb1502ca83fe73a343a4f2dd33f628a
Related-Bug: #1741377

commit_message:
Limit usage of old OVS to Rocky only

As we've landed fix for CentOS to work properly with new OVS and
workarounded bug, we can now start using new OVS version for stream.

Exclude can be removed once issue will be sorted out for Rocky as well.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron/+/878911
Change-Id: I864cb07231ebf5c820c2ce3721323bebdc337e13

subject: Disable CentOS LXC jobs due to the bug in systemd packaging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-31 14:37:20.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/project.yaml'], 'message': "Disable CentOS LXC jobs due to the bug in systemd packaging

At the moment systemd-udev package is being resolved to
systemd-boot-unsigned due to CentOS packaging issue. Resolution to this
issue would be providing a full path to any of file that is not provided
but systemd-boot-unsigned but provided by systemd-udev
which does not have a really clean and good workaround.

So we're disabling CentOS LXC jobs for now and waiting for CentOS
waiting to fix this. There're bunch of bug reports and all systemd there
in quite a messy state overall.

Change-Id: I6e744d1e708df11204b3436c53ea6ed723683b18
(cherry picked from commit dffcff7c94804433f8fbbe4b326f7f39d11fe0b7)
"}]
commit_message:
Disable CentOS LXC jobs due to the bug in systemd packaging

At the moment systemd-udev package is being resolved to
systemd-boot-unsigned due to CentOS packaging issue. Resolution to this
issue would be providing a full path to any of file that is not provided
but systemd-boot-unsigned but provided by systemd-udev
which does not have a really clean and good workaround.

So we're disabling CentOS LXC jobs for now and waiting for CentOS
waiting to fix this. There're bunch of bug reports and all systemd there
in quite a messy state overall.

Change-Id: I6e744d1e708df11204b3436c53ea6ed723683b18
(cherry picked from commit dffcff7c94804433f8fbbe4b326f7f39d11fe0b7)

subject: Pin tox to < 4.0.0
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2023-03-23 17:52:58.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Pin tox to < 4.0.0

Tox 4.0.0 was recently released and it has several breaking changes.
We pin to < 4.0.0 here. We are planning to move forward only on the
master charm branches.

Tox is also pinned to < 4.0.0 for stable branches in upstream
openstack-zuul-jobs as well as in zosci-config. However, the
requires= section in the charm's tox.ini file ends up installing
tox>4, wiping out the zuul-pinned tox<4 that was already installed
installed. This patch fixes that.

Related-Bug: #2002788
Change-Id: I4609031f6980cf5bda9ceaca2ec200b0187f181c
"}]
commit_message:
Pin tox to < 4.0.0

Tox 4.0.0 was recently released and it has several breaking changes.
We pin to < 4.0.0 here. We are planning to move forward only on the
master charm branches.

Tox is also pinned to < 4.0.0 for stable branches in upstream
openstack-zuul-jobs as well as in zosci-config. However, the
requires= section in the charm's tox.ini file ends up installing
tox>4, wiping out the zuul-pinned tox<4 that was already installed
installed. This patch fixes that.

Related-Bug: #2002788
Change-Id: I4609031f6980cf5bda9ceaca2ec200b0187f181c

  zuul.yaml
- removed too verbose logging from functests with list of images and

commit_message:
Prepare acceptance tests for real clouds

- reworked job not to use custom modules, but rather send direct API
  requests (due to mess with ensuring openstacksdk availability for
  Ansible).
- add exclude for pre-commit-config to stop it from complaining on
  zuul.yaml
- removed too verbose logging from functests with list of images and
  flavors (on real clouds this is simply too much).

Change-Id: I555127f410b696e1584dc07cafac25597ab1abeb

commit_message:
Replace old Antelope cycle key with 2023.2/Bobcat

This is a zuul-encrypted export of the signing subkey for the
OpenStack 2023.2/Bobcat release cycle:
0x815AFEC729392386480E076DCC0DFE2D21C023C9

This was created using the instructions from our documentation:
https://docs.opendev.org/opendev/system-config/latest/signing.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/878143

Change-Id: Ie19c164d3aa0711420f5deb90237f0268c174942

subject: Publish the 2023.2/Bobcat key for future use
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-03-31 12:11:48.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/static/0x815AFEC729392386480E076DCC0DFE2D21C023C9.txt', 'doc/source/index.rst'], 'message': 'Publish the 2023.2/Bobcat key for future use

This adds a listing for the 2023.2/Bobcat Cycle key fingerprint with
Friday 2023-03-31 (the week after the 2023.1/Antelope release) as
its start date, and links to an export of the corresponding public
key with initial attestation signature from the 2023.1/Antelope
Cycle key as well as the change author.

Change-Id: I9aaf9b7d513f6b2845a518c84ea2c381ff297220
'}]
commit_message:
Publish the 2023.2/Bobcat key for future use

This adds a listing for the 2023.2/Bobcat Cycle key fingerprint with
Friday 2023-03-31 (the week after the 2023.1/Antelope release) as
its start date, and links to an export of the corresponding public
key with initial attestation signature from the 2023.1/Antelope
Cycle key as well as the change author.

Change-Id: I9aaf9b7d513f6b2845a518c84ea2c381ff297220

commit_message:
Add cross-nova-pep8 job

Both cinder and nova CI got broken by a recent mypy bump [0],[1].
We can try to catch these issues before the requirements update gets
merged. See also [2] for the corresponding cinder test job.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/875534
[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/878693
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/878690

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/878693
Change-Id: I737a50e7efa2c67987f08aebc3ec0b0448ad73e5

subject: Unpin nodeset for tag-releases
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-23 16:19:25.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/jobs.yaml'], 'message': "Unpin nodeset for tag-releases

Previously tag-releases job was pinned [1] to ubuntu-focal (when the
default nodeset was still ubuntu-bionic) in order to get the newest
git-review. The default nodeset is ubuntu-jammy for some time already,
so let's remove the node pinning to use the default node set instead.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/763797

Change-Id: Id50570f8533483f1665a74824c77fc1e6019ebee
"}]
commit_message:
Unpin nodeset for tag-releases

Previously tag-releases job was pinned [1] to ubuntu-focal (when the
default nodeset was still ubuntu-bionic) in order to get the newest
git-review. The default nodeset is ubuntu-jammy for some time already,
so let's remove the node pinning to use the default node set instead.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/763797

Change-Id: Id50570f8533483f1665a74824c77fc1e6019ebee

revisions:

commit_message:
Fix floating ip selection

The floating ip selection didn't count with possibility of
stopped workloads on the environment. We now list running hosts
and join them against available virtual ips.

Co-authored-by: Lukas Bezdicka <social@v3.sk>
Change-Id: I6c5f0a6f6df1a18fa7e98b9476f83e289dae7211

commit_message:
Fix floating ip selection

The floating ip selection didn't count with possibility of
stopped workloads on the environment. We now list running hosts
and join them against available virtual ips.

Change-Id: I7d46100eccf43159f47e620d14fae3b66701a4d9

commit_message:
Fix ORM caching for with_for_update calls

The SQLAlchemy recommends to use populate_existing() when using
with_for_update() [0], it fixed issues with the caching of the objects.

This patch precisely fixes a bug when locking of a loadbalancer in the
batch member update API call, the load balancer might not have been
locked correctly and race conditions could have occurred (processing
simultaneously 2 requests in the workers for the same load balancer).

[0] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/orm/query.html#sqlalchemy.orm.Query.with_for_update

commit_message:
Add new API tests for active field in the allowed_address_pairs

That new field is added to the allowed_address_pairs attribute with
patch [1]. This patch adds new API tests to test if Neutron sets proper
active/inactive values for such VIP address configured in the ports from
the same network.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/601336

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/601336

Change-Id: Ic7a7b28072f40ed7535f7124174cf4fc8d20d1e2

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-07-15 08:39:33.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/temp_url_tests_digest_config-3d8c9bb271961ddd.yaml', 'tempest/api/object_storage/test_object_temp_url_negative.py', 'tempest/config.py', 'tempest/api/object_storage/test_object_temp_url.py'], 'message': 'Add config option for algo to use in temp_url tests

This is so to configure which hashlib algorithm should be used for
the temp_url tests, defaulting to sha256 but preserving the
ability to use sha1 for compatibility with other Swift implementations.

Change-Id: Ia4923d47870fcb914a33adecb7155763ec1d0b2f
'}]
commit_message:
Add config option for algo to use in temp_url tests

This is so to configure which hashlib algorithm should be used for
the temp_url tests, defaulting to sha256 but preserving the
ability to use sha1 for compatibility with other Swift implementations.

Change-Id: Ia4923d47870fcb914a33adecb7155763ec1d0b2f

commit_message:
Fixes permission problem when restoring backup

This PR changes the owner of the file used by the docker container that
resets the mysql root password.

Original problem is the failure to restore mysql:5.7.x backup. The error
occurs because the container process tries to update the file that owned
by the others.

Story: 2010467
Task: 47017
Change-Id: I3d8ebaac4ee5e13af83c305ce28b51e4442d8c8b
(cherry picked from commit 553c578923d30d0eb15ad5dbd0a2c583cae274a4)

commit_message:
Fixes permission problem when restoring backup

This PR changes the owner of the file used by the docker container that
resets the mysql root password.

Original problem is the failure to restore mysql:5.7.x backup. The error
occurs because the container process tries to update the file that owned
by the others.

Story: 2010467
Task: 47017
Change-Id: I3d8ebaac4ee5e13af83c305ce28b51e4442d8c8b
(cherry picked from commit 553c578923d30d0eb15ad5dbd0a2c583cae274a4)

subject: feat : use --no-cache-dir flag to pip in dockerfiles to save space
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-12-18 07:12:44.000000000', 'files': ['prometheus-openstack-exporter/Dockerfile.ubuntu_bionic', 'elasticsearch-s3/Dockerfile.7_6_2', 'nagios/Dockerfile.ubuntu_bionic', 'tempest/Dockerfile.ubuntu_focal', 'osh-selenium/Dockerfile.ubuntu_bionic', 'vbmc/Dockerfile.centos_7', 'vbmc/Dockerfile.suse_15', 'calicoctl-utility/Dockerfile.alpine', 'elasticsearch-s3/Dockerfile.7_1_0', 'osh-selenium/Dockerfile.opensuse_15', 'ospurge/Dockerfile.ubuntu_bionic'], 'message': 'feat : use --no-cache-dir flag to pip in dockerfiles to save space

using the "--no-cache-dir" flag in pip install, make sure downloaded packages by pip don't cache on the system. This is a best practice that makes sure to fetch from a repo instead of using a local cached one. Further, in the case of Docker Containers, by restricting caching, we can reduce image size. In terms of stats, it depends upon the number of python packages multiplied by their respective size. e.g for heavy packages with a lot of dependencies it reduces a lot by don't cache pip packages.

Further, more detailed information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibf318b853ed7e9a9be08ddfdf3a59bebd8c0b38e
'}]
commit_message:
feat : use --no-cache-dir flag to pip in dockerfiles to save space

using the "--no-cache-dir" flag in pip install, make sure downloaded packages by pip don't cache on the system. This is a best practice that makes sure to fetch from a repo instead of using a local cached one. Further, in the case of Docker Containers, by restricting caching, we can reduce image size. In terms of stats, it depends upon the number of python packages multiplied by their respective size. e.g for heavy packages with a lot of dependencies it reduces a lot by don't cache pip packages.

Further, more detailed information can be found at

https://medium.com/sciforce/strategies-of-docker-images-optimization-2ca9cc5719b6

Signed-off-by: Pratik Raj <rajpratik71@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibf318b853ed7e9a9be08ddfdf3a59bebd8c0b38e

subject: Do not forcefully re-apply network config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-23 07:08:58.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/playbooks/cli-overcloud-node-network-config.yaml'], 'message': 'Do not forcefully re-apply network config

Currently network configs are reapplied in all nodes during node
provisioning with --network-config or network provisioning. This is
because the network-config playbook forcefully override the flag to
run network configuration tasks.

This removes that override so that we by default do not reapply network
configurations to avoid network disruptions in existing nodes. Users
can still forcefully apply network configurations by setting
the tripleo_network_config_update var.

Resolves: rhbz#2181107
Change-Id: Ia61ccdbcb43ff69b002dce85f80db438c5904587
'}]
commit_message:
Do not forcefully re-apply network config

Currently network configs are reapplied in all nodes during node
provisioning with --network-config or network provisioning. This is
because the network-config playbook forcefully override the flag to
run network configuration tasks.

This removes that override so that we by default do not reapply network
configurations to avoid network disruptions in existing nodes. Users
can still forcefully apply network configurations by setting
the tripleo_network_config_update var.

Resolves: rhbz#2181107
Change-Id: Ia61ccdbcb43ff69b002dce85f80db438c5904587

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Note that https://github.com/openstack/charms.openstack is used during tests
and he need `mock`, unfortunatelly it doesn't declare `mock` in its
requirements so it retrieve mock from other charm project (cross dependency).
So we depend on charms.openstack first and when
Ib1ed5b598a52375e29e247db9ab4786df5b6d142 will be merged then CI
will pass without errors.

Depends-On: Ib1ed5b598a52375e29e247db9ab4786df5b6d142
Change-Id: I1d7de2bd4d704ffc331fdeacea725e903890f296
(cherry picked from commit 1de27bc18f8879c4782476a8daacbdf0a1cb7077)
(cherry picked from commit 946ae6b1d2fee6cfaa8f884e01f8e9795b654dd8)
(cherry picked from commit f1f2f405d4662177a726ae90f03932ad6ec7f57b)

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Note that https://github.com/openstack/charms.openstack is used during tests
and he need `mock`, unfortunatelly it doesn't declare `mock` in its
requirements so it retrieve mock from other charm project (cross dependency).
So we depend on charms.openstack first and when
Ib1ed5b598a52375e29e247db9ab4786df5b6d142 will be merged then CI
will pass without errors.

Depends-On: Ib1ed5b598a52375e29e247db9ab4786df5b6d142
Change-Id: I1d7de2bd4d704ffc331fdeacea725e903890f296

commit_message:
Make path for tcpdump release-specific

subject: Disable CentOS LXC jobs due to the bug in systemd packaging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-30 17:47:30.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/project.yaml'], 'message': "Disable CentOS LXC jobs due to the bug in systemd packaging

At the moment systemd-udev package is being resolved to
systemd-boot-unsigned due to CentOS packaging issue. Resolution to this
issue would be providing a full path to any of file that is not provided
but systemd-boot-unsigned but provided by systemd-udev
which does not have a really clean and good workaround.

So we're disabling CentOS LXC jobs for now and waiting for CentOS
waiting to fix this. There're bunch of bug reports and all systemd there
in quite a messy state overall.

Change-Id: I6e744d1e708df11204b3436c53ea6ed723683b18
"}]
commit_message:
Disable CentOS LXC jobs due to the bug in systemd packaging

At the moment systemd-udev package is being resolved to
systemd-boot-unsigned due to CentOS packaging issue. Resolution to this
issue would be providing a full path to any of file that is not provided
but systemd-boot-unsigned but provided by systemd-udev
which does not have a really clean and good workaround.

So we're disabling CentOS LXC jobs for now and waiting for CentOS
waiting to fix this. There're bunch of bug reports and all systemd there
in quite a messy state overall.

Change-Id: I6e744d1e708df11204b3436c53ea6ed723683b18

commit_message:
[ceph-client] Allow pg_num_min to be overridden per pool

This change allows the target pg_num_min value (global for all
pools) to be overridden on a per-pool basis by specifying a
pg_num_min value in an individual pool's values. A global value for
all pools may not suffice in all cases.

Change-Id: I42c55606d48975b40bbab9501289a7a59c15683f

commit_message:
Fix rescue of volume-based instances

Rescue of volume-based instances is supported since Nova
microversion 2.87.
However, Horizon does not use this microversion when requesting
rescue of any instances, causing a Nova exception for volume-
based ones.

The patch fixes this by explicitly setting the required
microversion.

Closes-Bug: #1941744
Signed-off-by: Jan Hartkopf <jhartkopf@inovex.de>
Change-Id: Ic0cdfd326475882f839fd218cd7b4bfa62a2a76b
(cherry picked from commit 05dd53a3cf3e1ced265d23d1c02765abd468a483)
(cherry picked from commit 761e466e7a0628ae939dd654152f615732ad4f79)

commit_message:
Ensure systemd-udev is installed for gluster

We're relying on udev to exists for glusterfs since we're
applying overrides for it as well as attempting to restart.

While systemd-udev seems not being pre-installed in all CentOS
containers anymore.

Change-Id: Ia03ee4aeb381da00a538e3775b824f2a5ce4e01e

subject: Accept both 1 and Y as AMD SEV KVM kernel param value
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-30 17:08:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_host.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/host.py'], 'message': 'Accept both 1 and Y as AMD SEV KVM kernel param value

The libvirt virt dirver checks the AMD KVM kernel module parameter SEV
to see if that feature is enabled. However it seems that the
/sys/module/kvm_amd/parameters/sev file can either contain "1\n" or
"Y\n" to indicate that the feature is enabled. Nova only checked for
"1\n" so far making the feature disabled on compute nodes with "Y\n"
value. Now the logic is extended to accept both.

Closes-Bug: #1975686
Change-Id: I737e1d73242430b6756178eb0bf9bd6ec5c94160
(cherry picked from commit ab51a5dd25b8d4c66562148b43b1022eb5ceed7e)
(cherry picked from commit 8a1b4975f71f9ce1446db689afb092d6e0a670a7)
'}]
commit_message:
Accept both 1 and Y as AMD SEV KVM kernel param value

The libvirt virt dirver checks the AMD KVM kernel module parameter SEV
to see if that feature is enabled. However it seems that the
/sys/module/kvm_amd/parameters/sev file can either contain "1\n" or
"Y\n" to indicate that the feature is enabled. Nova only checked for
"1\n" so far making the feature disabled on compute nodes with "Y\n"
value. Now the logic is extended to accept both.

Closes-Bug: #1975686
Change-Id: I737e1d73242430b6756178eb0bf9bd6ec5c94160
(cherry picked from commit ab51a5dd25b8d4c66562148b43b1022eb5ceed7e)
(cherry picked from commit 8a1b4975f71f9ce1446db689afb092d6e0a670a7)

subject: Modify release notes, project docs name guidelines
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2023-02-20 20:11:13.000000000', 'files': ['reference/release-naming.rst'], 'message': "Modify release notes, project docs name guidelines

The guidelines as currently written emphasize OpenStack over the
individual project, even in the projects' own release notes or
documentation. This may cause confusion to operators and contributors
for projects under OpenStack governance, but can be used standalone or
as part of other systems -- such as Ironic.

Ensure those standalone projects have the option, when sensible, to omit
the full OpenStack integrated release moniker in favor of their
independent version.

Change-Id: Icf014dcaef459e564ab3d13b1ba7f620bdcf478d
"}]
commit_message:
Modify release notes, project docs name guidelines

The guidelines as currently written emphasize OpenStack over the
individual project, even in the projects' own release notes or
documentation. This may cause confusion to operators and contributors
for projects under OpenStack governance, but can be used standalone or
as part of other systems -- such as Ironic.

Ensure those standalone projects have the option, when sensible, to omit
the full OpenStack integrated release moniker in favor of their
independent version.

Change-Id: Icf014dcaef459e564ab3d13b1ba7f620bdcf478d

OVS 3.1 was released by CentOS NFV SIG which is built against newer
rdma-core libraries leading to uninstallable openvswitch3.1 on
Rocky Linux due to missing libmlx5.so.1(MLX5_1.24).

commit_message:
Pin openvswitch package on RHEL to 2.17

OVS 3.1 was released by CentOS NFV SIG which is built against newer
rdma-core libraries leading to uninstallable openvswitch3.1 on
Rocky Linux due to missing libmlx5.so.1(MLX5_1.24).

While CentOS doesn't need this specific rollback, it will be easier to
fix gates this way.

Change-Id: I388c115d368c0c0638d1dd4f9f11f4448a13a6b1

This is supported natively by OpenStack-Ansible but the deployment

the deployer and image properties to be applied by end users.

This patch adds a documentation section oriented around the

commit_message:
Add documentation for multi-architecture deployments.

This is supported natively by OpenStack-Ansible but the deployment
considerations are subtle and require appropriate overrides by
the deployer and image properties to be applied by end users.

This patch adds a documentation section oriented around the
user story of adding new aarch64 compute nodes to an existing
x86_64 deployment.

Change-Id: Ie517a46b0e5452a78d9a5ad05e9bb778e71398ef

commit_message:
CI: Disable disk image build in seed-upgrade jobs

Fix bifrost overrides which was wrongly applied, we need to use dib.yml instead of bifrost.yml, like in kayobe-seed-base.

The original commit also disables overcloud_dib_build_host_images. This
change is kept but is not relevant for Yoga.

Change-Id: I1edafbb41a26587a5ef794b3b9886fdf189a0a1a
(cherry picked from commit 77ca0771958713804d2c65b8e33824a6573132fe)

This build takes time and can fail due to lack of disk space. It got
enabled when we changed overcloud_dib_build_host_images to true.

Also fix bifrost overrides which was wrongly applied, we need to use
dib.yml instead of bifrost.yml, like in kayobe-seed-base.

Change-Id: I1edafbb41a26587a5ef794b3b9886fdf189a0a1a
(cherry picked from commit 77ca0771958713804d2c65b8e33824a6573132fe)
'}]
commit_message:
CI: Disable disk image build in seed-upgrade jobs

This build takes time and can fail due to lack of disk space. It got
enabled when we changed overcloud_dib_build_host_images to true.

Also fix bifrost overrides which was wrongly applied, we need to use
dib.yml instead of bifrost.yml, like in kayobe-seed-base.

Change-Id: I1edafbb41a26587a5ef794b3b9886fdf189a0a1a
(cherry picked from commit 77ca0771958713804d2c65b8e33824a6573132fe)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-03-23 19:36:27.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'message': '[sqlalchemy-20] query.join should define one table/column per call

The method ``get_router_for_floatingip`` query needs to define a join
clausule per table or column to be joined.

The expected query is the following one:
  SELECT DISTINCT routerports.router_id AS routerports_router_id,
  ipallocations.ip_address AS ipallocations_ip_address

  FROM routerports
    JOIN ports ON ports.id = routerports.port_id
    JOIN ipallocations ON ports.id = ipallocations.port_id
    JOIN ports AS gw_port ON gw_port.device_id = routerports.router_id

  WHERE ports.network_id = ?
    AND routerports.port_type IN (XXX)
    AND ipallocations.subnet_id = ?
    AND gw_port.network_id = ?
    AND gw_port.device_owner = ?

The goal is to retrieve the router that matches the GW IP, that is in
the same subnet and network as provided.

Closes-Bug: #2012643

Change-Id: Id054ffaca17153ff470b6bc91f7c3da4f7bf0fdc
'}]
commit_message:
[sqlalchemy-20] query.join should define one table/column per call

The method ``get_router_for_floatingip`` query needs to define a join
clausule per table or column to be joined.

The expected query is the following one:
  SELECT DISTINCT routerports.router_id AS routerports_router_id,
  ipallocations.ip_address AS ipallocations_ip_address

  FROM routerports
    JOIN ports ON ports.id = routerports.port_id
    JOIN ipallocations ON ports.id = ipallocations.port_id
    JOIN ports AS gw_port ON gw_port.device_id = routerports.router_id

  WHERE ports.network_id = ?
    AND routerports.port_type IN (XXX)
    AND ipallocations.subnet_id = ?
    AND gw_port.network_id = ?
    AND gw_port.device_owner = ?

The goal is to retrieve the router that matches the GW IP, that is in
the same subnet and network as provided.

Closes-Bug: #2012643

Change-Id: Id054ffaca17153ff470b6bc91f7c3da4f7bf0fdc

subject: [OVN] OVN agent should register "Chassis_Private" by default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-24 14:35:31.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/ovn/agent/ovn_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': '[OVN] OVN agent should register "Chassis_Private" by default

The event "SbGlobalUpdateEvent", loaded by default in the Neutron OVN
Agent, reads from OVN SB "SB_Global" table and writes in the
"Chassis_Private" table. The last one is missing in the default tables
that are registered during the SB IDL initialization.

Closes-Bug: #2012385
Change-Id: I51d64375e69f27b265fbaba4d05a03a37c65929e
(cherry picked from commit 2ccf1e1e90c0643daea19ae3f6c42e59aaac9423)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] OVN agent should register "Chassis_Private" by default

The event "SbGlobalUpdateEvent", loaded by default in the Neutron OVN
Agent, reads from OVN SB "SB_Global" table and writes in the
"Chassis_Private" table. The last one is missing in the default tables
that are registered during the SB IDL initialization.

Closes-Bug: #2012385
Change-Id: I51d64375e69f27b265fbaba4d05a03a37c65929e
(cherry picked from commit 2ccf1e1e90c0643daea19ae3f6c42e59aaac9423)

subject: Save previous hd boot device when setting Pxe
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10342, 'name': 'Jay Faulkner', 'display_name': 'JayF', 'email': 'jay@jvf.cc', 'username': 'JayF'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23851, 'name': 'Riccardo Pittau', 'email': 'elfosardo@gmail.com', 'username': 'elfosardo'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2023-01-12 12:51:29.000000000', 'files': ['sushy_tools/emulator/resources/systems/libvirtdriver.py', 'sushy_tools/tests/unit/emulator/domain_to_boot_pxe.xml', 'sushy_tools/tests/unit/emulator/resources/systems/test_libvirt.py'], 'message': 'Save previous hd boot device when setting Pxe

Assuming that sushy_tool ignores "BootSourceOverrideEnabled": "Once" for
libvirt backend, we define a new boot device permanently. And if the pxe
server does not reply after the first\xa0successful\xa0\xa0provision, we just get a
vm which doesn't manage to boot after provision because netboot is the only
option and no reply from pxe.

This patch adds two additional lists of previously configured boot hard drives
for the vm at the end of the boot order. The first list is for the os section
If it is defined, it just adds all hard drives to the list. The second list is
for the actual drive section with the boot directive.\xa0

Tried to save script logic as much as possible. But it might be reasonable to
pass one additional argument to the\xa0set_boot_device function to\xa0do such
altering when "BootSourceOverrideEnabled" is defined\xa0and has "Once" as a value

Added testcase to verify boot order definition

Change-Id: I0abcab9ccbffcc9b06382b0e6d335edd20db25bf
'}]
commit_message:
Save previous hd boot device when setting Pxe

Assuming that sushy_tool ignores "BootSourceOverrideEnabled": "Once" for
libvirt backend, we define a new boot device permanently. And if the pxe
server does not reply after the first successful  provision, we just get a
vm which doesn't manage to boot after provision because netboot is the only
option and no reply from pxe.

This patch adds two additional lists of previously configured boot hard drives
for the vm at the end of the boot order. The first list is for the os section
If it is defined, it just adds all hard drives to the list. The second list is
for the actual drive section with the boot directive. 

Tried to save script logic as much as possible. But it might be reasonable to
pass one additional argument to the set_boot_device function to do such
altering when "BootSourceOverrideEnabled" is defined and has "Once" as a value

Added testcase to verify boot order definition

Change-Id: I0abcab9ccbffcc9b06382b0e6d335edd20db25bf

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-06 09:09:09.000000000', 'files': ['ovn_octavia_provider/tests/unit/test_driver.py', 'ovn_octavia_provider/helper.py', 'ovn_octavia_provider/driver.py', 'ovn_octavia_provider/tests/unit/test_helper.py'], 'message': "Remove HM uuiid from LB external_ids when the HM's pool is deleted

The expected behavior when a HM is deleted is that any reference to it
in the LB's external_ids must be cleanup or removed. Until this patch,
this reference was not removed when the pool associated to the HM
is deleted.

Closes-Bug: #2008695
Change-Id: Ieeef917d9e293af27e5feed14335f25fd9a6fb48

commit_message:
Remove HM uuiid from LB external_ids when the HM's pool is deleted

The expected behavior when a HM is deleted is that any reference to it
in the LB's external_ids must be cleanup or removed. Until this patch,
this reference was not removed when the pool associated to the HM
is deleted.

Closes-Bug: #2008695
Change-Id: Ieeef917d9e293af27e5feed14335f25fd9a6fb48
(cherry picked from commit cc30eae60c57a5b46e3e564875b67d7bb5edfff5)

commit_message:
Active-active L3 Gateway with Multihoming

The aim of the RFE is to add multihoming support to routers along with
automatic management of ECMP for default routes and BFD next-hop
reachability verification.

https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/2002687

Co-Authored-By: Frode Nordahl <frode.nordahl@canonical.com>
Related-Bug: #2002687
Change-Id: I95a0d5f1b7aef985df5625cd83222799db811f2b

commit_message:
Switch back Puppet OpenStack to cycle-with-intermediary

This change updates the release model of Puppet OpenStack based on
the discussion during the previous release[1]. For these repos we do
not create rc but directly release GA.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/860887

Change-Id: I7cb24dcdfa53789dbeec482c33cd9975e094bc54

commit_message:
Upgrade of Kubernetes

This PS upgrades the following components:
- minikube to 1.29.0
- kubernetes to 1.26.3
- calico to 3.25
- coredns to 1.9.4

Also this PS adds cri-dockerd required for kubernetes newer than 1.24
and adds recirsive response to coredns.

subject: Add support for subsections
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2023-03-07 19:57:02.000000000', 'files': ['examples/notes/add-complex-example-6b5927c246456896.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/support-subsections-583600c47b3c7d49.yaml', 'reno/config.py', 'reno/tests/test_config.py', 'reno/formatter.py', 'reno/tests/test_formatter.py'], 'message': "Add support for subsections

Subsections will appear underneath their top-level section, in
the order defined in the config file. They will use a ^ or ~
underline rather than -.

Users define subsections by adding a number to the end
of the section entry, either 2 or 3. It will be a subsection
of the parent section above it. This syntax is simpler than others
considered, like nesting lists inside a top-level section. It also
makes it easy for us to support deeper levels of nesting if we'd like.

Like normal sections, in users' notes files, they will use the
ID they define for each subsection.

Change-Id: Ib7b4781de81e19d11a7acb863204067c0946827b
Story: 2010375
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for subsections

Subsections will appear underneath their top-level section, in
the order defined in the config file. They will use a ^ or ~
underline rather than -.

Users define subsections by adding a number to the end
of the section entry, either 2 or 3. It will be a subsection
of the parent section above it. This syntax is simpler than others
considered, like nesting lists inside a top-level section. It also
makes it easy for us to support deeper levels of nesting if we'd like.

Like normal sections, in users' notes files, they will use the
ID they define for each subsection.

Change-Id: Ib7b4781de81e19d11a7acb863204067c0946827b
Story: 2010375

subject: Ensure systemd-udev is installed for gluster
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2023-03-29 17:51:24.000000000', 'files': ['roles/glusterfs/tasks/main.yml', 'zuul.d/project.yaml'], 'message': "Ensure systemd-udev is installed for gluster

We're relying on udev to exists for glusterfs since we're
applying overrides for it as well as attempting to restart.

While systemd-udev seems not being pre-installed in all CentOS
containers anymore, so we should ensure it's installed
before trying to adjust it's unit file.

Change-Id: I7d952b371bdfa41c17eaa4248b8249ca772258bc
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure systemd-udev is installed for gluster

We're relying on udev to exists for glusterfs since we're
applying overrides for it as well as attempting to restart.

While systemd-udev seems not being pre-installed in all CentOS
containers anymore, so we should ensure it's installed
before trying to adjust it's unit file.

Change-Id: I7d952b371bdfa41c17eaa4248b8249ca772258bc

subject: Default molecule verifier to ansible for podman driver
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-11-01 16:55:05.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/roles/login_defs/molecule/default/molecule.yml', 'tripleo_ansible/roles/login_defs/molecule/default/verify.yml', 'tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_kernel/molecule/default/molecule.yml', '_skeleton_role_/molecule/default/molecule.yml', 'tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_sshd/molecule/gssapi/molecule.yml', '.config/molecule/config_podman.yml'], 'message': 'Default molecule verifier to ansible for podman driver

ansible is the default verifier for molecule, however this patch sets it
explicitly for the podman driver for readability.

The login_defs, tripleo_kernel, and tripleo_sshd roles still had their
verifiers set to testinfra in their individual molecule.yml configs.
That resulted in the verify.yml for these roles being ignored and never
executed. That configuration is removed in favor of just inheriting the
config from the base molecule config for the podman driver.

This also updates the _skeleton_role_ to remove the verifier configured
as testinfra.

Note that many other roles still have their verifier set to testinfra,
however they have no ansible tests in a verify.yml or any pytests
defined. These can be cleaned up in a different patch.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I05f79b5675ceb5d56622001ef94f0a47ffd0bc87
'}]
commit_message:
Default molecule verifier to ansible for podman driver

ansible is the default verifier for molecule, however this patch sets it
explicitly for the podman driver for readability.

The login_defs, tripleo_kernel, and tripleo_sshd roles still had their
verifiers set to testinfra in their individual molecule.yml configs.
That resulted in the verify.yml for these roles being ignored and never
executed. That configuration is removed in favor of just inheriting the
config from the base molecule config for the podman driver.

This also updates the _skeleton_role_ to remove the verifier configured
as testinfra.

Note that many other roles still have their verifier set to testinfra,
however they have no ansible tests in a verify.yml or any pytests
defined. These can be cleaned up in a different patch.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I05f79b5675ceb5d56622001ef94f0a47ffd0bc87

commit_message:
Revert "Refactor Zaqar to satisfy openstack uwsgi goal"

This is necessary if using nova-compute with RBD backend (directly,
not via Cinder) and wishing to make an instance image to Glance
while (1) following the recommended Ceph permissions which do not
give Nova write permissions to the images' pool or (2) not using
RBD with Glance or (3) not revealing what Glance actually uses

commit_message:
Support qemu block rbd in nova-compute

This is necessary if using nova-compute with RBD backend (directly,
not via Cinder) and wishing to make an instance image to Glance
while (1) following the recommended Ceph permissions which do not
give Nova write permissions to the images' pool or (2) not using
RBD with Glance or (3) not revealing what Glance actually uses
as the backend (hiding locations).

Closes-Bug: #2013075

Change-Id: I88e1e0ca01b2b2effad9515b905cc761fbb5d2d4
(cherry picked from commit 9e92e4c8e494ec345ccce1eff739f18bf9035c9b)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-24 14:34:52.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/ovn/agent/ovn_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': '[OVN] OVN agent should register "Chassis_Private" by default

The event "SbGlobalUpdateEvent", loaded by default in the Neutron OVN
Agent, reads from OVN SB "SB_Global" table and writes in the
"Chassis_Private" table. The last one is missing in the default tables
that are registered during the SB IDL initialization.

Closes-Bug: #2012385
Change-Id: I51d64375e69f27b265fbaba4d05a03a37c65929e
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] OVN agent should register "Chassis_Private" by default

The event "SbGlobalUpdateEvent", loaded by default in the Neutron OVN
Agent, reads from OVN SB "SB_Global" table and writes in the
"Chassis_Private" table. The last one is missing in the default tables
that are registered during the SB IDL initialization.

Closes-Bug: #2012385
Change-Id: I51d64375e69f27b265fbaba4d05a03a37c65929e

which was checking if context.system_scope is "all" in case when

commit_message:
Don't check context.system_scope to check project scope

During first attempt of the Secure RBAC implementation [1] to
function model_query_scope_is_project() there was added check
which was checking if context.system_scope is "all" in case when
scope enforcement was enabled. It was like that because that meant
that it is SYSTEM_* persona context (e.g. SYSTEM_ADMIN).
This is not needed now as later it was agreed to have only one ADMIN
user which will still behave like old, "legacy" ADMIN user.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/781075

Conflicts:
    neutron_lib/db/utils.py
    neutron_lib/tests/unit/db/test_utils.py

Closes-bug: #1996150
Change-Id: If3a97c4d3a0f4cb6b4d06434f74cbe9d933a07a4
(cherry picked from commit 91759b17ea5d4d6563596612208e6014dee2ed88)

commit_message:
Don't check context.system_scope to check project scope

During first attempt of the Secure RBAC implementation [1] to
function model_query_scope_is_project() there was added check
which was checking if context.system_scope is "all" in case when
scope enforcement was enabled. It was like that because that meant
that it is SYSTEM_* persona context (e.g. SYSTEM_ADMIN).
This is not needed now as later it was agreed to have only one ADMIN
user which will still behave like old, "legacy" ADMIN user.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/781075

Conflicts:
    neutron_lib/db/utils.py
    neutron_lib/tests/unit/db/test_utils.py

Closes-bug: #1996150
Change-Id: If3a97c4d3a0f4cb6b4d06434f74cbe9d933a07a4
(cherry picked from commit 91759b17ea5d4d6563596612208e6014dee2ed88)
